content: hi @wg-incr-comp ; we are scheduled to have a meeting tomorrow (at 2020-12-15T08:00:00-05:00 if I recall correctly). I'm tempted to say that it will be recorded but not posted on YouTube publicly (or any other publicly-accessible venue), in order to make it more inviting to contributors who are not thrilled about on YouTube. Any thoughts?
I believe recording a Zoom meeting makes a local (not cloud) copy right? That should probably be clarified. This seems fine to me :thumbs_up:
That works for me - I have commitments later in the day that I might prefer to prepare for so I can't guarantee that I'll attend tomorrow, but I might.
I've definitely been making local copies and then posting them myself
When I was using Mozilla's zoom account, I might have gone the cloud-hosted route, i cannot recall now.
I might be able to join but can't promise yet. I won't be able to make it. There's just too much stuff to do before Berlin goes into another hard lockdown tomorrow :cant_talk:

Since you are not publishing the video, will you provide some meeting report?
(I cannot attend, my day job is not related to programming)
I did record the video locally, so I can look into sharing it privately.
(or I could try to draft notes. there wasn't too much stuff reported. might be easier and more useful to make the notes.)

The TLDRW is that with the holidays approaching, everyone has been pretty busy and not much has happened over the last two weeks. The next meeting would be 2020-12-29 but as that's right at the end of the year, we don't think much will change by then so we're going to skip that one and pick back up meeting in January.
